p: Unlike human mechanism, which close full-thickness skin wound by scar formation, mice and rats heal primarily by contraction of panniculus carnosus muscle. Thus, to avoid misinterpretation of the effects of babassu oil on wound healing, a full-thickness splinted wound model was used to prevent wound contraction and allowed the wound to heal by granulation and re-epithelialization, similar to what happens in humans [ 20].
